denest.network.models¶

NEST model classes.

class denest.network.models.Model(name, params, nest_params)¶

Bases: denest.base_object.NestObject

Represent a model in NEST.

During creation, we copy or change the default parameters of the nest_model NEST model.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the model

  • params (dict-like) – params of the object. Should countain the nest_model key.

  • nest_params (dict-like) – Dictionary passed to NEST during the nest.CopyModel of nest.SetDefaults call.

RESERVED_PARAMS = []¶
MANDATORY_PARAMS = ['nest_model']¶
OPTIONAL_PARAMS = {}¶
RESERVED_NEST_PARAMS = None¶
MANDATORY_NEST_PARAMS = None¶
OPTIONAL_NEST_PARAMS = None¶
create(*args, **kwargs)¶

Create or update the NEST model represented by this object.

If the name of the base nest model and of the model to be created are the same, update (change defaults) rather than copy the base nest model.

class denest.network.models.SynapseModel(name, params, nest_params)¶

Bases: denest.network.models.Model

Represents a NEST synapse.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the model

  • params (dict-like) –

    params of the object. Should countain the nest_model key. The following keys are recognized:

    • receptor_type, target_neuron (str): Name of the

      receptor type (eg “AMPA”) and of the target neuron for synapses of this type. If specified, the receptor_type NEST parameter (which is an integer) is automatically set from the defaults of the target neuron.

  • nest_params (dict-like) – Dictionary passed to NEST during the nest.CopyModel of nest.SetDefaults call. The weight parameter, which sets the synapse model’s default weight is reserved. To set the strength of projections, set the weights parameter of projection objects instead.

..note::

NEST expects ‘receptor_type’ to be an integer rather than a string. The integer index must be found in the defaults of the target neuron.

RESERVED_NEST_PARAMS = ['weight']¶
